data.title: Your Favorite Cars Of 2014 And Beyond -- AFTER/DRIVE
data.description:
We asked you which cars you were excited to see in 2014, and you told us. Here's your top 10 list, plus a preview of the cars you'll see for the first time at the Detroit Auto Show next week. With Jason Harper, Bloomberg News; Automobile magazine; and Zac Moseley, Classic Car Club Manhattan.

Jason Harper
"Horsepower, Too Much?"

data.title: The Fixer and the Samurai - /TUNED
data.description: When we arrived in Panama City, all our plans completely fell apart. We had nothing, and no one. Until Joel Bolanos came along, became our fixer, and saved our trip. In this film, we take Joel's brilliant custom Suzuki Samurai up in the Cerro Azul, Panama's mountain region, for a little off roaring adventure.

data.title: "The Myth" of Panama's 900 HP Evo - /TUNED
data.description: It's the rainy season in Panama, and that means if we want to go fast, we're gonna need some AWD performance. Fortunately, we've got the keys to Race Lab's 900 HP Mitsubishi Evolution 7. Now if we can just find somewhere to run it....

data.title: How to Build an Audi R8 V10 Plus - /INSIDE QUATTRO
data.description: The R8 V10 Plus is a special Audi that shows off the craftsmanship of Quattro GmbH.  Leo Parente tours the special assembly shop where the R8 comes together.  While the shop is high-tech, there is still a hand-built element to the construction of the R8.

data.title: The Answer is Always Miata - /TUNED
data.tags: Mazda Miata, MX-5, Miata, Harris Hill Raceway, V8 Miata
data.description: Ask any car guy, what would make a good first car? Miata. What would make a good weekend car? Miata. What would make a good tuner car? Miata. What would be a good race car? Miata. What could I drive that Chris Harris won't like? Miata. It seems the answer is always Miata. This week, CJ Wilson Racing and Continental Tire invite us to Austin, TX to test two of their best Miatas on the track.

data.title: The 500 AWHP, AWD, Hillclimbing, Psycho Syclone - /TUNED
data.description: We end our fourth season with probably our favorite subject car of all time, Adam Auerbach's GMC Syclone Hillclimber. This truck is what "Tuned" is all about; customized in every way possible, 100% function with form following suit. It's nasty, dirty, evil, and perfect.

data.title: Here's Why You Must Buy A Porsche 911 Today -- AFTER/DRIVE
data.description: The air-cooled Porsche 911 has become the poster child of a receding age of cars with driving character. And the prices are reflecting buyers' excitement. Should you get your hands on one now, any way you can, or is there a Porsche 911 bubble waiting to burst? With Zac Moseley and Mike Prichinello from Classic Car Club Manhattan.

data.title: What Will Happen When Cars Talk To Each Other? -- AFTER/DRIVE
data.description: With the U.S. government ready to make vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) technology not only legal, but required, it's time we find out just what it means for drivers. Will privacy concerns overshadow safety and other benefits? With Andrew Del-Colle, Senior Editor of Popular Mechanics and J.F. Musial, Executive Producer of /DRIVE

data.title: Road Race-T: 1927 LeMons Racer - /BIG MUSCLE
data.description:
Owner:
• Dennis "Fish" Newman / Dave Schaible

It's got a 5.0L engine out of an old Ford Mustang, the front end off a Pinto and a frame that's almost 100 years old. The Road Race T is the creation of Dennis Newman and Dave Schaible and was constructed to compete in the 24 Hours of LeMons, a 24 hour endurance race where the original purchase price of the car can be no more than $500.00.  It's small, light and thanks to its amazingly talented builders, has the ability to put the hurt on the majority of its competition.

data.title: 2015 Subaru WRX STI: Everything You Need To Know -- AFTER/DRIVE
data.description: Subaru's newest STI has been criticized for keeping the same 300+hp engine as the previous STI. Others were turned off by its new design. But is the 2015 STI actually a far better car, despite its specs? We find out. With Jason Harper, Bloomberg News and Automobile; and Travis Okulski, deputy editor of Jalopnik.

data.title: The 1360HP Heart of the Koenigsegg One:1 - Inside Koenigsegg
data.tags: Koenigsegg One:1, supercar, worlds fastest car, twin turbo, 5.0L V8, carbon fiber
data.description: Christian von Koenigsegg explains how his team has developed the new Koenigsegg One:1 5.0-liter twin-turbocharged V8 engine which produces 1,360 hp and 1,371 N·m (1,011 lb·ft) of torque at 6000 rpm.Total weight of the engine is only 197 kg (434 lb) thanks to a carbon fiber intake manifold and the aluminum construction. The transmission is a 7-speed dual clutch with paddle shifters.

asset.title: The 1360HP Heart of the Koenigsegg One:1 - Inside Koenigsegg
asset.description: Christian von Koenigsegg explains how his team has developed the new Koenigsegg One:1 5.0-liter twin-turbocharged V8 engine which produces 1,360 hp and 1,371 N·m (1,011 lb·ft) of torque at 6000 rpm.Total weight of the engine is only 197 kg (434 lb) thanks to a carbon fiber intake manifold and the aluminum construction. The transmission is a 7-speed dual clutch with paddle shifters.

data.title: Muscle Evolved: Modding a Mustang GT
data.tags: 2013 Ford Mustaing GT, suspension, handling, Cortex Racing, Mustang suspension parts
data.description:
When it comes to cornering, the Ford Mustang has always been a bit lack luster. Factory attempts to cure this have been valiant (Boss 302, SVT Cobra R), however sometimes you need to think outside the box to get to the next level. The /BIG MUSCLE garage acquired a 2013 Mustang GT last year and were thrilled, until that is, we took it to the track. There we found Cortex Racing and with that, the understanding that with the right set of legs underneath it, even an over weight pony car can be made into an evil piece of track day weaponry.

Owner:
• /BIG MUSCLE Garage

data.title: The 3D Printed Variable Turbo - /INSIDE KOENIGSEGG
data.tags: 3D printed turbo, Koenigsegg, turbocharged, variable turbo
data.description:
Christian von Koenigsegg showcases the One:1's patented variable turbo, providing the perfect boost for any RPM level. 

Fully 3D printed, with moving parts printed within the enclosed chamber, something never done before.
